perturbation.original_text: Company understands that as a not-for-profit charitable organization Association cannot promote or endorse Company’s products or services, either explicitly or implicitly. The Association may require that a disclaimer stating that Company’s participation in this Agreement does not convey or imply the Association's approval, endorsement, certification, acceptance, or referral of any product or service of Company.
perturbation.changed_text: Company understands that as a not-for-profit charitable organization, the Association will actively promote and endorse Company’s products or services to the fullest extent possible, both explicitly and implicitly. The Association will not require any disclaimer stating that Company’s participation in this Agreement does not convey or imply the Association's approval, endorsement, certification, acceptance, or referral of any product or service of Company.
perturbation.explanation: This change directly contradicts the original text. Originally, the Association could not promote the Company's products. The revision makes it so the Association will actively endorse and promote the Company. This could create conflict as it pertains to the Association's tax-exempt status, and whether there will be an exchange in value.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall commence on March 15, 2018 and will expire on March 14, 2020 unless terminated earlier pursuant to Section 13 of the Agreement (the “Term”).
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall commence on March 15, 2018 and will automatically renew indefinitely on March 14, 2020. There is no termination clause.
perturbation.explanation: This change directly contradicts the original text. Originally, the contract had a clear expiration. The revision removes this expiration and renews the contract indefinitely. The absence of a termination clause further cements that there is no expiration date.

perturbation.original_text: Company may not permit any third party to use the Association Marks without the express prior written approval of the Association, which may be withheld for any reason.
perturbation.changed_text: Company is permitted to allow any third party to use the Association Marks without the express prior written approval of the Association, which shall not be withheld for any reason.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates direct conflict by stating that Company *can* allow third parties to use Association Marks. The modified version mandates that the Association cannot withhold approval, giving the Company free reign.
